text:
Iirc, even Local Accounts upgraded from Win7 to Win10(i.e. no MSA) store the
digital license(not Win10 key) on MSFT’s server. It may store the path that the
upgrade was done(7 to 10), but the license for that specific device is the
determining factor for a reinstall of Win10 on the same device. 
i.e. both Microsoft Accts(MSA) and Local Accounts are digitally licensed. Use
of an MSA links the device to that account and offers an additional feature not
available in a Local Account – Additional trouble shooting steps available only
to a MSA logon on the licensed device. 
…w
%40BYAPR05MB6552.namprd05.prod.outlook.com

Win 7 no longer upgrading to Win10 - no more reinstalling PCs 
Iirc, even Local Accounts upgraded from Win7 to Win10(i.e. no MSA) store the
digital license(not Win10 key) on MSFT’s server.  It may store the path that the
upgrade was done(7 to 10), but the license for that specific device is the
determining factor for a reinstall of Win10 on the same device. 
i.e. both Microsoft Accts(MSA) and Local Accounts are digitally licensed.  Use
of an MSA links the device to that account and offers an additional feature not
available in a Local Account – Additional trouble shooting steps available only
to a MSA logon on the licensed device.
